info.title: Factify API
info.description:
Factify API enables you to create, manage, and control access to legally-binding documents that replace PDFs.

## Authentication

Bearer authentication header of the form Bearer <token>, where <token> is your auth token.

```
Authorization: Bearer ffy...
```

## Rate Limiting

- 1000 requests per minute per API key
- 100 requests per minute for resource creation (POST)

## Errors

Factify uses conventional HTTP status codes and returns structured error responses:

```json
{
  "error": {
    "type": "invalid_request_error",
    "message": "Document title cannot be empty",
    "param": "title",
    "code": "missing_required_field"
  }
}
```

tags.name: Documents
tags.description: Create, retrieve, update, and manage documents.

tags.name: Versions
tags.description: Manage document versions and version history.

tags.name: Organizations
tags.description: Create and manage organizations and member invitations.

tags.name: API Keys
tags.description: Generate and manage API keys for authentication.

tags.name: Policies
tags.description: Attach and manage access policies for documents.

tags.name: Sharing & Distribution
tags.description: Generate shareable entry pages for documents.

tags.name: DocumentService
tags.description:
DocumentService provides operations on documents.
 Tags default to "DocumentService", post-processor renames to "Documents".

tags.name: EntryPageService
tags.description:
EntryPageService provides operations for document entry pages.
 Tags default to "EntryPageService", post-processor renames to "Sharing & Distribution".

tags.name: IdentityService
tags.description:
IdentityService provides APIs for managing API keys.
 Enables programmatic access through API key generation and management.

 v1beta Scope:
 - Services and service accounts are NOT exposed in v1beta. When an organization
   is created, default service and service account are provisioned internally.
 - API keys grant organization admin privileges. Granular permissions will be
   added in a future version.

 Authorization Model:
 - CreateApiKey: Requires organization admin role.
 - ListApiKeys: Requires organization admin role.
 - RevokeApiKey: Requires organization admin role.

 Lifecycle Management:
 - API keys can be created and revoked but not updated. Use revoke + create for rotation.

tags.name: OrganizationService
tags.description:
OrganizationService provides APIs for managing organizations and member invitations.

 Authorization Model:
 - CreateOrganization: Any authenticated user. The caller becomes the organization owner.
   Specifying owner_user_id for a different user requires system maintainer role.
 - GetOrganization/ListOrganizations: Requires organization membership.
 - Invitation operations: Requires organization#manage permission.

 Lifecycle Management:
 - Organizations are immutable after creation (no update/delete).
 - Invitations can be created, revoked, and resent. They expire after 7 days. ==========================================================================
 Organizations
 ==========================================================================

tags.name: PolicyService
tags.description:
PolicyService provides operations on document policies.
 Tags default to "PolicyService", post-processor renames to "Policies".

tags.name: VersionService
tags.description:
VersionService provides operations on document versions.
 Tags default to "VersionService", post-processor renames to "Versions".

bearerAuth.description: Bearer authentication header of the form Bearer <token>, where <token> is your auth token.

Forbidden.description: Authorization failed - valid key but insufficient permissions

error.message: You do not have permission to access this resource
An unexpected error occurred. Please try again later.
Too many requests. Retry after 30 seconds.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: Unix timestamp when rate limit resets

Unauthorized.description: Authentication failed - missing or invalid API key

code.description: Specific error code for detailed handling

param.description: Parameter that caused the error (for validation errors)

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying (for rate limit errors)

id.title: id
id.description:
Unique ID for the API key.
 Pattern: key_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

organization_id.title: organization_id
organization_id.description:
ID of the organization this key belongs to.
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

created_at.title: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp when the key was created.

expires_at.title: expires_at
expires_at.description: Expiration timestamp. If set, the key becomes invalid after this time.

is_active.title: is_active
is_active.description:
Whether the key is currently active (not revoked and not expired).
 Computed: is_active = (revoked_at == null) && (expires_at == null || expires_at > now())

key_prefix.title: key_prefix
key_prefix.description:
Truncated key prefix for identification in UI (e.g., "ffy_prod_01jd4h5...").
 Shows the first 16 characters for better uniqueness while maintaining security.

revoked_at.title: revoked_at
revoked_at.description: Timestamp when the key was revoked. Null if the key has not been revoked.

factify.api.v1beta.ApiKey.title: ApiKey
factify.api.v1beta.ApiKey.description: ApiKey represents an authentication credential for programmatic API access.

policy_id.title: policy_id
policy_id.description:
Policy ID to attach.
 Pattern: pol_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

factify.api.v1beta.AttachPolicyRequest.title: AttachPolicyRequest
factify.api.v1beta.AttachPolicyRequest.description: AttachPolicyRequest specifies a policy to attach to a document.

organization_id.title: organization_id
organization_id.description:
Organization ID to create the key for.
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

expires_at.title: expires_at
expires_at.description:
Expiration timestamp. If not set, the key does not expire.
 When set, must be in the future and within 1 year.
 Security note: Keys without expiration should be rotated periodically.
timestamp.gt_now = true
timestamp.within = 8760h0m0s

factify.api.v1beta.CreateApiKeyRequest.title: CreateApiKeyRequest
factify.api.v1beta.CreateApiKeyRequest.description: CreateApiKeyRequest contains the data needed to create a new API key.

secret.title: secret
secret.description:
The API key secret. This is only returned once and cannot be retrieved later.
 Format: ffy_{env}_{base32_uuid7}{base62_random}
 - env: "prod" or "test"
 - base32_uuid7: 26 chars (TypeID base32 alphabet: 0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z)
 - base62_random: 43 chars (0-9A-Za-z)
 Store this value securely - it will not be shown again.
 SECURITY WARNING: This field must NEVER be logged. Handlers must redact secrets from all logs.

factify.api.v1beta.CreateApiKeyResponse.title: CreateApiKeyResponse
factify.api.v1beta.CreateApiKeyResponse.description: CreateApiKeyResponse contains the newly created API key and its secret.

access_level.title: access_level
access_level.description: Document access level. Defaults to organization if user belongs to an org, otherwise private.

payload_key.title: payload_key
payload_key.description: Storage key for uploaded file (set by server)

include_revoked.title: include_revoked
include_revoked.description:
Whether to include revoked keys in the response.
 Default: false (only active and expired-but-not-revoked keys are returned).
 When true, all keys including revoked ones are returned.
 Note: Expired keys are always included unless also revoked; use is_active to filter.

page_token.description:
Opaque pagination token from a previous response.
 Pass next_page_token or prev_page_token from a previous response to continue pagination.
 Empty or omitted for the first page.

ListDocumentPoliciesRequest specifies pagination for listing document policies.
 Follows Google AIP-158 for pagination field naming.

factify.api.v1beta.ListDocumentPoliciesR.description: ListDocumentPoliciesResponse contains a page of policy attachments.

page_token.title: page_token
page_token.description:
Opaque pagination token from a previous response.
 Pass next_page_token or prev_page_token from a previous response to continue pagination.
 Empty or omitted for the first page.

page_size.title: page_size
page_size.description: Maximum number of items to return per page (1-100). Default: 50.

created.title: created
created.description:
Filter by creation time range.
 REST: ?created.after=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&created.before=2024-12-31T23:59:59Z

created_by_id.title: created_by_id
created_by_id.description:
Filter by creator ID(s) (user or service account). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified IDs.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?created_by_id=user_01h2xcejqtf2nbrexx3vqjhp41 or ?created_by_id=user_xxx,svc_yyy

access_level.title: access_level
access_level.description:
Filter by access level(s). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified levels.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?access_level=private or ?access_level=private,organization
 Accepts clean enum names (case-insensitive): "private", "organization", "public"

processing_status.title: processing_status
processing_status.description:
Filter by processing status(es). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified statuses.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?processing_status=ready or ?processing_status=processing,ready,failed
 Accepts clean enum names (case-insensitive): "processing", "ready", "failed"

factify.api.v1beta.ListDocumentsRequest.title: ListDocumentsRequest
factify.api.v1beta.ListDocumentsRequest.description:
ListDocumentsRequest specifies filters and pagination for listing documents.
 Follows Google AIP-158 for pagination field naming.
 Uses Vanguard-compatible dot notation for nested filters: ?created.after=...&created.before=...
created_time_range // created.after must be before created.before

status.title: status
status.description:
Filter by status. If empty, returns all invitations.
 ORGANIZATION_INVITE_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED (0) is not a valid filter value.

page_token.title: page_token
page_token.description: Opaque pagination token from a previous response.

page_size.title: page_size
page_size.description: Maximum number of items to return per page (1-100). Default: 50.

email.title: email
email.description:
Filter by email address.
 REST: ?email.contains=dwight or ?email.exact=dwight@dundermifflin.com

sender_id.title: sender_id

created.title: created
created.description:
Filter by creation time range.
 REST: ?created.after=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&created.before=2024-12-31T23:59:59Z

expires.title: expires
expires.description:
Filter by expiration time range.
 Useful for finding invitations expiring soon (expires.before) or still valid beyond a date (expires.after).
 REST: ?expires.after=2024-01-01T00:00:00Z&expires.before=2024-01-31T23:59:59Z

factify.api.v1beta.StringFilter.title: StringFilter
factify.api.v1beta.StringFilter.description:
StringFilter provides flexible string matching options.
 Used with Vanguard dot notation: ?email.contains=john or ?email.exact=john@example.com

 Note on case sensitivity: `contains` is case-insensitive for user-friendly partial
 matching (e.g., finding "john" matches "John.Doe@..."). `exact` is case-sensitive
 for precise lookups where the caller knows the exact value. For email addresses,
 this matches RFC 5321 behavior where the domain is case-insensitive but local-part
 handling varies by provider.
mutually_exclusive // only one of contains or exact can be specified

factify.api.v1beta.TimestampFilter.title: TimestampFilter
factify.api.v1beta.TimestampFilter.description:
TimestampFilter specifies a time range for filtering.
 Used with Vanguard dot notation: ?created.after=...&created.before=...

get.description: Lists API keys for an organization.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description:
Organization ID to list keys for.

Organization ID to list keys for.

parameters.name: include_revoked
parameters.description:
Whether to include revoked keys in the response.
 Default: false (only active and expired-but-not-revoked keys are returned).
 When true, all keys including revoked ones are returned.
 Note: Expired keys are always included unless also revoked; use is_active to filter.

schema.title: include_revoked
schema.description:
Whether to include revoked keys in the response.
 Default: false (only active and expired-but-not-revoked keys are returned).
 When true, all keys including revoked ones are returned.
 Note: Expired keys are always included unless also revoked; use is_active to filter.

parameters.name: created_by_id
parameters.description:
Filter by creator ID(s) (user or service account). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified IDs.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?created_by_id=user_01h2xcejqtf2nbrexx3vqjhp41 or ?created_by_id=user_xxx,svc_yyy

schema.title: created_by_id
schema.description:
Filter by creator ID(s) (user or service account). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified IDs.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?created_by_id=user_01h2xcejqtf2nbrexx3vqjhp41 or ?created_by_id=user_xxx,svc_yyy

parameters.name: access_level
parameters.description:
Filter by access level(s). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified levels.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?access_level=private or ?access_level=private,organization
 Accepts clean enum names (case-insensitive): "private", "organization", "public"

schema.title: access_level
schema.description:
Filter by access level(s). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified levels.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?access_level=private or ?access_level=private,organization
 Accepts clean enum names (case-insensitive): "private", "organization", "public"

parameters.name: processing_status
parameters.description:
Filter by processing status(es). Returns documents matching ANY of the specified statuses.
 Accepts single value or comma-separated list.
 REST: ?processing_status=ready or ?processing_status=processing,ready,failed
 Accepts clean enum names (case-insensitive): "processing", "ready", "failed"

post.summary: Invite a user to join an organization
post.description: Creates an invitation and sends an email to the specified address. Returns FAILED_PRECONDITION if the email belongs to an existing organization member. Idempotency: If a PENDING invitation already exists for this email, the existing invitation is resent with a new token and refreshed expiration. Expired or revoked invitations are ignored - a new invitation is created.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description:
Organization to invite the user to.
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

schema.title: organization_id
schema.description:
Organization to invite the user to.
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

organization_id.title: organization_id
organization_id.description:
Organization to invite the user to.
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

message.title: message
message.description: Optional custom message from the sender (max 2000 bytes to support ~500 multibyte characters).

idempotency_key.title: idempotency_key

schema.title: CreateOrganizationInviteRequest
schema.description: CreateOrganizationInviteRequest contains the data needed to create an invitation.

post.description: Accepts the invitation and adds the authenticated user as a member of the organization. The authenticated user's verified email must match the invitation email (case-insensitive). Returns PERMISSION_DENIED if emails don't match, FAILED_PRECONDITION if the user is already a member, or NOT_FOUND if the invitation is invalid/expired.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description:
Organization the invitation belongs to (for validation).
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

schema.title: organization_id
schema.description:
Organization the invitation belongs to (for validation).
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

organization_id.title: organization_id
organization_id.description:
Organization the invitation belongs to (for validation).
 Pattern: org_[0-9a-hjkmnp-tv-z]{26}

token.title: token
token.description: The invitation token from the email link.

schema.title: AcceptOrganizationInviteRequest
schema.description: AcceptOrganizationInviteRequest contains the token to accept an invitation.

post.description: Resend an invitation email to the recipient. Useful if the original email was lost or expired. Requires permission to invite organization members.
